meanings.definition: Existing at or from the beginning of time; original.
meanings.sent1: The primordially beautiful flower bloomed in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The primordially ancient ruins stood tall in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The primordially wise owl shared its knowledge with the young birds.
meanings.sent4: Her primordially kind heart warmed everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The primordially peaceful lake reflected the clear blue sky above.

meanings.definition: In a way that is fundamental or basic.
meanings.sent1: She primordially believed in the power of kindness.
meanings.sent2: The rules of the game were primordially simple to understand.
meanings.sent3: He primordially danced with joy at the news of his promotion.
meanings.sent4: The idea of family was primordially ingrained in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The primordially strong foundation supported the entire building.

meanings.definition: In a way that is essential or inherent.
meanings.sent1: The values of honesty and integrity were primordially important to him.
meanings.sent2: She primordially knew that hard work would lead to success.
meanings.sent3: The laughter of children filled the room primordially, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent4: His primordially caring nature made him a favorite among his friends.
meanings.sent5: The primordially loyal dog never left his owner's side.
